greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) (n >= 2, k >= 1) of Raney numbers read by rows.
comment: There are only m nonzero entries in the m-th column.
Related to A033282: shift row n of A033282 triangle n places to the right and transpose the resulting table. - _Michel Marcus_, Feb 04 2014
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=2..100 of triangle, flattened
G. Kreweras, Les préordres totaux compatibles avec un ordre partiel, Math. Sci. Humaines No. 53 (1976), 5-30 (see definition p. 26 and table p. 27).
G. N. Raney, Functional composition patterns and power series reversion, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc., 94 (1960), pp. 441-451.
formula: T(n,k) = C(k, n-k) * C(n, k+1)/k. - _Michel Marcus_, Feb 04 2014
mathematica: Table[Binomial[k, n-k]*Binomial[n, k+1]/k, {n,2,10}, {k,1,n-1}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 17 2019 *)
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {for (n = 2, nn, for (k = 1, n-1, print1(binomial(k, n-k)*binomial(n, k+1)/k, ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 04 2014
(MAGMA) [[Binomial(k,n-k)*Binomial(n,k+1)/k: k in [1..n-1]]: n in [2..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 17 2019
(Sage) [[binomial(k,n-k)*binomial(n,k+1)/k for k in (1..n-1)] for n in (2..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 17 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([1..10], n->List([1..n-1], k-> Binomial(k,n-k)*Binomial(n ,k+1)/k ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 17 2019
xref: Sum of nonzero entries in each column gives A001003. Alternating sum of each column is 1. Second diagonal on right gives A000096.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 21 2003
ext: Corrected and extended by _Michel Marcus_, Feb 04 2014
